Properties.Name: Text
Properties.Value:
This Workflow retrieves Contacts from Acumatica filtered by customer name, splits them into individual records, and checks if each contact has already been processed (using a key-value store). 
If not processed, it maps and updates the contact in a SQL table. 
Success or error statuses are logged for future reporting. 
If a contact was already processed successfully, a message is generated instead of updating SQL.

Nodes.Name: VariableBar
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are setting the Key-Value Group

Nodes.Name: Formatter
Nodes.LongDescription: Display a message if the Contact has previously been processed

Nodes.Name: SetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are setting the Success Status for future reporting.

Nodes.Name: Acumatica
Nodes.LongDescription: Retrieves a list of Acumatica Contacts filtered on the Customer Name

Properties.Name: Description
Properties.Value: Retrieves records that satisfy the specified conditions from the system.

Properties.Name: Response

Nodes.Name: ForEach
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are splitting the Contacts into individual records

Properties.Name: Item

Nodes.Name: GetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we check to see if the ContactID has been processed before by checking if a Key Value record has already been logged for this ContactID.

Nodes.Name: IfVisualBasic
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are verifying that if the Contact has been found in the Key-Value Group, it should only continue downstream processing if has been logged as an error.
Success records display a message indicating that the Contact has already been processed.

Nodes.Name: QuickMap
Nodes.LongDescription: Map the Customer data from Acumatica to be updated into a SQL Table

Properties.Name: Mapping

Nodes.Name: SqlTableUpdate
Nodes.LongDescription: Adding the Contact to an SQL Table

Properties.Schema:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?>
<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="Table">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" name="Contacts">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="id" type="xs:unsignedByte" />
              <xs:element name="first_name" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="last_name" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="company_name" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="address" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="city" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="county" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="state" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="zip" type="xs:unsignedInt" />
              <xs:element name="phone1" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="phone" type="xs:string" />
              <xs:element name="email" type="xs:string" />
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Nodes.Name: IfVisualBasic
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are validating the number of RowsAffected in SQL

Nodes.Name: SetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are setting the Error Status for future reporting

Name: Acumatica to Microsoft SQL Contacts
Description:
This Workflow retrieves and splits Acumatica Contacts by customer name, checking each against a key-value store to avoid duplicates.
Unprocessed contacts are mapped and updated in a SQL table, with statuses logged and messages generated for previously processed entries.
